definition: mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival/interdependent
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Forrest Gump and his mother had each other.
sentences.chinese: 阿甘和他的母亲相依为命。

sentences.english: Jack is a young boy. He lives with his mother.
sentences.chinese: 杰克是一个年轻小伙子，他与妈妈相依为命。

sentences.english: The mother and daughter shared their life together, supporting each other through years of hardship.
sentences.chinese: 母女俩相依为命度过了苦难的岁月。

sentences.english: We belong perpetually to each other-for life or for death.
sentences.chinese: 我们永远相依为命，同生死。

sentences.english: They had lived on each other all these years.
sentences.chinese: 这些年来他们一直相依为命。

sentences.english: Su Rose is a good student living with her mother for many years after the death of her father.
sentences.chinese: 苏玫瑰是个品学兼优的女生，和母亲一起相依为命。

sentences.english: Dai 3 brother parents double die, depend on each other from now on.
sentences.chinese: 戴氏三兄弟父母双亡，从此相依为命。

sentences.english: He lost her parents, and follow the uncle aunt.
sentences.chinese: 自幼失去双亲的她，跟着舅舅舅妈相依为命。

sentences.english: While living with his father, he worked hard in the fields.
sentences.chinese: 董永从小和父亲相依为命，每天在田里辛勤劳作。

sentences.english: I was ten years old. My grandmother and I are alone in the world.
sentences.chinese: 如今我和祖母在这个世界上孤孤单单，相依为命。

sentences.english: The old lady lives alone, only one Tomcat with her life.
sentences.chinese: 老太太一生孤独，只有一只雄猫与她相依为命。

sentences.english: Slow fire with him and they had each other, want to party want to escape the clutches.
sentences.chinese: 他和文火伴们相依为命，想方想办法逃出魔掌。

sentences.english: At that moment, they truly felt that they were depending on each other.
sentences.chinese: 那一刻，他们才真正有相依为命的感觉。

sentences.english: San left our sisters and mother.
sentences.chinese: 留下了我们姊妹弎和母亲相依为命。

sentences.english: Mother and son on the way Xiangyiweiming days to live.
sentences.chinese: 母子俩就这样相依为命地过着日子。

sentences.english: Her mother died of illness early with her father.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈因病去逝早，爸爸与她相依为命。

definition: no one to rely on (idiom); on one's own/orphaned/left to one's own devices
to have lost both one's parents
to be orphaned of one's father
mother and child/parent and subsidiary (companies)/principal and interest
